review:
A nice card game, wrapped in a finicky program. 

[h2]The card game [/h2]
The card game is an asymmetrical battle, stimulating the Battle of the Bulge in Belgium and Northern France at the end of '44, where Germany marched into Allied territory. So the Axis forces outnumber the Allied forces in the start of the game, and they have to try to push six squares in 15 turns. The Allied receive better reinforcements each turn. 
Cards can be units (legs or mech, which can move 1 or 2 spaces per turn, and they are valued in numbers with artillery, tank and infantry, which attack in order by diceroll), terrain or events. 
The asymmetrical part is really nice, because it's a very different game what side you are playing. Some reviewers compare it with Risk or Chess, however I can't see any resemblance with another game. 

[h2]Digitalisation [/h2]
I haven't played the physical game, so I can't really tell if the conversion is faithful, but I assume it is. The game is presented without a tutorial or any kind of guidance. There is a text manual inside, but not very attractively presented. For some reason it never became clear to me where what reinforcements are allowed to enter the battle, I just followed the green indicator. 
The AI is bad... The way to win is to let the AI spread their forces, which she likes to do, and concentrate your own. The AI will destroy itself upon your wall. 
It would be nice if the dicerolls were presented on screen. 

[h2]My experience [/h2]
My first two battles I lost vigorously, without understanding the rules. One of those times, I built a thin defenseline, responded by the AI with a card to ignore my units and double moving past me. But I pushed on, committing to complete the game. 
While I enjoyed the card game, the program around it is a bit clunky. It one of those classic cases to recommend this game or not, and a this one falls towards the not-pile. It's a shame that the overall assessment is mostly negative, it's not that bad... 

[h2]'Nuts!'?[/h2]
During the historical battle, the Germans proposed that the Allied surrendered with an ultimatum to the general. When the general read this ultimatum, he crumbled the letter to a ball and threw it away with the words: 'aw, nuts!' The officers used this statement as official response to the Germans, like:
[i]To the German Commander. 
NUTS! 
The American Commander. [/i]  
The Germans didn't understand this statement, so the delivering officer explained: 'Go to hell!' The general didn't like to use profanity, his staple expression was 'nuts!'. 
More information on [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anthony_McAuliffe]Wikipedia. [/url] 

56/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198002546338', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1608330296}
review:
Éste es un interesante juego táctico de cartas que trata de recrear la batalla de las Árdenas de la Segunda Guerra Mundial.
Lo primero que me gustaría decir es que las reseñas negativas de usuarios que han jugado entre 10 minutos y 2 horas son una plaga en Steam. Hay juegos cuya mecánica de entiende al momento y otros que necesitan un tiempo de aprendizaje. La verdad es que un tutorial interactivo vale su peso en oro, y por desgracia muchos desarrolladores no se molestan en implementarnos. Éste es el caso. En Nuts! tenemos una sección de reglas y otra de cómo jugar que al pillarte frío resultan absolutamente incomprensibles. Yo he acabado entendiendo someramente el juego a base de ensayo-error. Y tengo que decir que me gusta. Es interesante. No voy a explicar la mecánica jugable porque no lo sé jugar a fondo. Pero puedo decri, por encima, que es un juego en el que se emplean cartas como refuerzos y otras como eventos. Los refuerzos se colocan en las áreas que llevan impresas y los eventos se juegan en tu turno o en el turno del contrario.

El meollo consiste en que como estadounidense tienes que contener la ofensiva alemana y evitar que te cuelen unidades por la retaguardia y como alemán tienes que romper las líneas estadounidenses y pasar un número de unidades que puede ser 3 o 6 dependiendo de si juegas al mapa completo o a la sección norte o sur.
La interfaz es algo deficiente. Normalmente puedes ver qué unidades tiene el enemigo pero por alguna razón que se me escapa cuando te hace falta verlas para ejecutar una carta de evento, al hacer click en un stack de unidades no puedes ver cuáles la componen. Esto me parece no ya un error sino una estupidez. Porque hay cartas que fastidian a los componentes de una división. Si hay 13 unidades y estás intentando hacer el mayor daño posible quieres ver cuál es la división mayor, que se puede componer de a lo mejor 4 unidades. Pero no puedes. En fin, lo cierto es que Hexwar no acaba de pulir sus juegos y a veces se gana malas reseñas a pulso.

Pero el juego, que es una versión digital de un juego de mesa, está muy entretenido. La IA a veces comete lo que parecen ser ataques suicidas; por otro lado ésta es capaz de concentrar fuerzas para romper el frente. Yo creo que los ataques suicidas se pueden explicar por la razón de que es relativamente fácil destruir unidades (depende de una tirada de dado por unidad que tenga asignado un daño) y que una buena tirada en un combate desfavorable puede hacer que un defensor con 4 unidades tenga que sufrir las mismas bajas que un atacante en solitario.

Lo recomiendo. Pero ten en cuenta que si pretendes jugarlo tendrás que pasar un par de horas desentrañando su mecánica. Una vez hecho yo creo que te lo vas a pasar bastante bien durante bastantes horas. Además las partidas son relativamente cortas.

EDITO: después de varias horas de juego tengo que cambiar mi recomendación positiva sobre si comprar o no este juego. Ahora mismo NO lo compréis. Tiene varios bugs, pero uno específicamente convierte la experiencia en injugable. La explico: cuando usas un evento como un general o un efecto en una unidad de división, el juego hace algo muy raro. Las unidades disposibles para mover o atacar salen a la izquierda de la pantalla una sobre otra; pero si realizas una de las acciones que he dicho se crean huecos ENORMES entre esas unidades. La única manera de moverse entre las unidades cuando es necesario porque tienes muchas apiladas es hacer click con el ratón y arrastrar. No se puede hacer usando la rueda del ratón ni con las teclas del teclado. La distancia que se crea entre las unidades hace que no puedas seleccionar las que quieres usar si no salen las primeras. Es un bug terrible, e incomprensible, que rompe tus partidas. Sobre todo si juegas con el bando alemán, que es con el que más se ataca y con el que creas apilamientos más grandes. Imagina que tienes 12 unidades y que quieres atacar con 6 unidades que forman 2 divisiones porque eso bonifica tus ataques (bonificaciones que hay que usar sí o sí si quieres ganar). Pues te aguantas porque sólo puedes seleccionar 5 unidades aleatorias, las 5 primeras de la lista.
La frustración es total. No entiendo cómo puede estar a la venta un juego con semejante fallo. Me parece que nadie lo ha testeado. El juego te impide usar sus propias mecánicas.
Esto se arreglaría permitiendo simplemente hacer scroll con la rueda del ratón (característica que no entiendo que no esté implementada), o arreglando el programa para que las unidades queden juntas unas con otras.
Di una valoración positiva pero tengo que desdecirme. Así que lo repito: NO compres este juego ni por 1 euro porque no vas a poder jugarlo.
He enviado un mensaje a Hexwar, el distribuidor del juego, comunicando estos fallos. Si lo arreglan, que no creo porque me da que Nuts! está abandonado actualmente, vlveré a recomendarlo. De lo contrario huid de él como de la peste.

Y es una pena porque el juego es entretenidísimo, su mecánica muy atractiva y la versión digital te ofrece un adversario IA las 24 horas del día y tira los dados y hace los cálculos por ti.

Shady. Game itself is the worst of two worlds, all the superficiality of a board game and all the incompetent user interface and complicated on screen information of a turn based grand strategy game. Win and lose conditions are convoluted, game is slow turn based with lots of card drawing. I tried dragging and dropping i tried right and left click I could not seem to interact with the game to accomplish anything. Tutorial is endless sea of text as a button in the main menu. 우연한 기회에 싸게 구입한 게임인데 호기심에 잠시 설치했다가 시작과 동시에 도전과제 한개가 달성되어버려서 이왕하는거 100% 해볼까해서 시작한 게임이다. (이 게임은 게임 시작과 동시에 도전과제 1개가 달성되니 이 점을 잘 알고 게임에 임하기 바랍니다.)

미국과 독일군 진영 중 하나를 선택하여 보드판내에서 적이 오지못하도록 사수하거나 어느 지점까지 탱크부대를 이동시키는 턴제 방식의 게임이다. 게임의 요령만 터득한다면 지극히 단순한 게임이라 플레이하기에는 어렵지 않다.
비록 영문이지만 게임내에 가이드가 있으니 그것을 참고하면 게임요령은 쉽게 익힐수 있다.
무조건 부대(보병, 탱크, 대포)수가 많으면 이길 가능성이 크진다. 많은 부대를 편성해서 적과 대전하면 손쉽게 이길수 있을 것이다.
미국을 선택하면 독일군이 좌측 끝으로 이동하지 못하도록 디펜스를 하면 되고, 독일군을 선택하면 맵에 따라서 탱크부대 3~6개를 좌측 끝으로 이동시켜주면 이기게 된다.

스팀 사용자 평가만 봐도 알수 있겠지만 딱히 그래픽, 게임성 등 게임요소가 뛰어난 점은 없어서 별다른 재미는 없다.
가격적으로 봐도 10,500원은 조금 비싼 느낌이다. 이 게임을 구입한다면 세일기간이나 번들로 구입할 것으로 권하고,
본 게임의 경우도 재미보다는 도전과제 달성용 게임으로 하면 좋을거같다.
도전과제는 달성하기가 쉬운 편이라 평균 10시간 플레이하면 무난하게 100% 달성이 가능하다.
도전과제 헌터분들한테는 기회가 된다면 한번쯤 해보라고 권한다.

98번째 도전과제 100% 달성한 게임.
(2016년 10월 6일 오후 4시 01분에 달성)

review:
NOTE: I DID PAY FOR THIS GAME

This is a card game, played on a 5x6 (or 3x6) chess-like board. It’s a very abstract representation of the Battle of the Bulge, there are two sides (Allies and Germany), two scenarios (North and South) and the full “campaign”, the German player objective is to push a given number of units to the other side of map, the Allies goal is to prevent that from happening.
The game is extremely easy and quick, a scenario can take up to 30 minutes and the full campaign probably 1 hour.
It’s fun and can be quite addictive until you have completed all scenarios.

PROS:
+ Easy, entertaining enough card game
+ The AI does a decent job when playing on the defence (Allies)
+ The event cards are indeed interesting

CONS
- Once you’re done with the campaign, there’s very little replayibilty
- At full price, it’s quite overpriced: get it on strong sale
- The AI does a poor job on the attack (Axis)
- Some non game-breaking bugs, still annoying

OVERALL:

6/10

review:
Well.. my idllemaster fucked up somehow and gave me 1 achievement before I even install the game.. so i figure.. what the heck.. let's give it a try...

this is a risk type of battle chess game between USA and Germany.. Germany start with better less location but heavier and more dense units. While usa have more areas and cities to get more cards...

Germany have to have certain number of mech unit acress to the usa defense line before 15 turns is up...

Over all.. it's well thought out and well planned battle chess with a lot intersting randomness and fun cards to use. The graphics is decent and music is .. well.. repeating war song that I don't hate..

2 games later.. i do enjoy this a bit.. but this game have issues which make me turn my review into negative for now..

1. AI.. well AI is not too smart.. AI units charge your defense position with impossible odds instead of waiting it out.. and don't defense strategicly... don't use a lot of cards.. it must be improved else human win every games.

2. Bugs.. yes.. many many bugs still left in this game...

 I once drag a reenforce unit to play in chess region but it got stuck in mid air and won't move.. blocks the center of my screen and it's not return to the starting location... i can no longer click it to move it. even after i click turn end. There is also one time.

 I use the card join attack to attack from 2 location, while the computer ask me to select two location. I clicked to use another card to negate one famous general ability... Which cause neither of cards goes into effect. And i am stuck that clicking nothing works on the screen. i cannot even click turn end.

Above are the two major one I have met after 3.5 hours of play...

As it's current status.. i cannot recommend it right now. 

May come back to it if this game gets it's bugs fixxed so i will work on rest of my achievements.

6.5/10 for now.. if it's bug free i would give it a 7.5 .. and yes.. not recommended to play right now.. avoid until bugs are fixed. I have made it thumb up right now so it would improve the rate of approval for now since it's not that bad of a game...

review:
《 Nuts!阿登战役》（为了保留麦考利夫的名言，姑且这么翻译吧），是一款从手机上移植过来的回合制卡牌式战争策略游戏。
       慈善包的CDkey，激活就显示出了一个“100 Allied Mech”的成就。但查看统计又没有。
       好奇心让我把它下了下来，打开，不到3分钟就遇上了bug，关掉。结果这成就竟然自己弹出来了，这回统计里有它了……于是  我的完成率就从35%降到了33%……[spoiler]诸位dalao别笑话我[/spoiler]
       游戏本身的创意还是不错的。然而我连第一关都过不了，因为在短短40分钟之内，我就遇到了以下bug：
[olist]
    [*]伤害超过单位总血量时，有时不会出现“继续”键
    [*]我方布置的单位卡一直停在半空
    [*]敌方布置的单位卡一直停在半空
    [*]我方使用事件卡后，屏幕下方的说明文字不消失
    [*]拖动单位攻击时画面停滞无法进入战斗界面
    [*]完成了所有可进行的行动后却无法点击箭头按钮开始下回合
    [*]保存时程序崩溃
[/olist]
       很显然，制作商在它上架前甚至没有进行过最基本的测试。


题外话：
[spoiler] 我有些闲，就看完了所有的评测。在我写这篇评测时（2016/5/27 utc+8 17:30），一共6篇评测，4篇好评；其中3篇英语，1篇俄语。最有价值的2篇好评（76% 64%）的用户资料都是私密；资料公开的2位好评者都只解锁了上文中的那个成就，且几个数值型成就的数值均为0；英语的3篇好评都在发售后很短时间内给出。
       而另一方面，2篇差评分别仅有22%和35%的人认为有价值。[/spoiler]

Hi there,

I brought this game on Steam and on Google play (Android).

I like card type war games and thought this could be good.

In its concept this is good idea and actually well thought out. 

But the execution is severely flawed.

The game literally crashes in the latter stages leaving you fuming waiting to execute your game changing move that never comes.

It doesn't even matter which side you play on (I had played both thinking it was a glitch).

It is a late stage event that ultimately ruins the game.

Wasted my time and money on it.

Avoid like the plague until someone cares enough to finish it properly.
